src/constants/error.js
content:
export const ERROR_FETCHING_EVENTS = error => `Unable to fetch events: ${error}`
export const MISSING_PARAMETERS = param => `Missing parameter ${param}`
export const CONTRACT_ERROR = error => `Contract Error: ${error}`
export const HTTP_ERROR = error => `HTTP Error: ${error}`
export const VALIDATION_ERROR = error => `Data Validation Error: ${error}`
export const PARAMETER_ERROR = error => `Parameter error: ${error}`

name: src/constants/hash.js
content:
/* eslint-disable prettier/prettier */
import sha3 from 'js-sha3'

export const functions = {
  0x14: sha3.sha3_512,
  0x15: sha3.sha3_384,
  0x16: sha3.sha3_256,
  0x17: sha3.sha3_224,
  0x1A: sha3.keccak224,
  0x1B: sha3.keccak256,
  0x1C: sha3.keccak384,
  0x1D: sha3.keccak512
}

name: getMetaEvidence
description:
Get the MetaEvidence object for a metaEvidenceID. Hashes will be validated.
By default MetaEvidence will be returned regardless of the validity of the hashes
with an indicator on whether the hash was valid or not. To throw an error instead,
use strict = true in options object.
NOTE: If more than one MetaEvidence with the same metaEvidenceID is found it will return the 1st one.

params.name: contractAddress
params.description: The address of the Arbitrable contract.

params.name: metaEvidenceID
params.description: The identifier of the metaEvidence log.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional paramaters. Includes fromBlock, toBlock, strictHashes

name: src/standards/index.js
src/utils/EventListener.js
content:
import isRequired from '../utils/isRequired'

/**
 * EventListener is used to watch events on the blockchain for a set of contracts.
 * Handlers for specific events can be added. When an event log is found EventListener
 * will fire all handlers registered for the contract.
 */
class EventListener {
  /**
   * Fetch logs from contractInstance for a specific event in a block range.
   * @param {object} contractInstance - Contract instance.
   * @param {string} eventName - Name of the event.
   * @param {number} fromBlock - Lower bound of search range.
   * @param {number} toBlock - Upper bound of search range.
   * @param {object} filters - Extra filters
   * @returns {Promise} All events in block range.
   */
  static getEventLogs = async (
    contractInstance = isRequired('contractInstance'),
    eventName = isRequired('eventName'),
    fromBlock = 0,
    toBlock = 'latest',
    filters = {}
  ) =>
    contractInstance.getPastEvents(eventName, {
      filter: filters,
      fromBlock,
      toBlock
    })
}

export default EventListener

name: EventListener
description:
EventListener is used to watch events on the blockchain for a set of contracts.
Handlers for specific events can be added. When an event log is found EventListener
will fire all handlers registered for the contract.

name: getEventLogs
description: Fetch logs from contractInstance for a specific event in a block range.

params.name: contractInstance
params.description: Contract instance.

params.name: eventName
params.description: Name of the event.

params.name: fromBlock
params.description: Lower bound of search range.

params.name: toBlock
params.description: Upper bound of search range.

params.name: filters
params.description: Extra filters

validateFileFromURI
description:
Validate a file. The file must include the hash as the suffix of the URI,
or the hash can be passed via the options parameter or using the Evidence standard
self hash.

unknown.tagValue: {object} The file as well as the validity of the hashes

params.name: fileURI
params.description: The URI of where the file data can be fetched

params.name: options
params.description: The optional paramaters that can be used to validate the file.

return.description: The file as well as the validity of the hashes

name: validMultihash
description: Validate a multihash.

params.name: multihashHex
params.description: The hexadecimal hash.

params.name: file
params.description: The object we are validating against.

params.name: customHashFn
params.description: <optional> A custom hash function used for file.

name: multihashFile
description: Create a base58 multihash from a file.

params.name: file
params.description: The object we are hashing.

params.name: multicode
params.description: The multicode of the hashing algorithm.

params.name: customHashFn
params.description: <optional> A custom hash function used for file.

name: src/utils/isRequired.js
isRequired
description:
Used as the default parameter for an arguemnt that is considered required. It will
throw an error if the argument is not supplied by the user.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the missing argument.

name: src/utils/sanitize.js
sanitizeMetaEvidence
description:
As the evidence standard changes we need to coerce past standards into the latest one.
Update this function to do silent transformations to support any legacy disputes.

name: src/utils/uri.js

content:
# Archon

> Archon provides functionality for Arbitrator and Arbitrable Ethereum smart contracts as defined in ERC 792 and ERC 1497.

## Documentation

See full documentation at https://archon.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html

## Installation

```
npm install @kleros/archon
```

## Basic Usage

```
var Archon = require('@kleros/archon');

var archon = new Archon('wss://some.local-or-remote.node:8546');

> archon.arbitrator
> archon.arbitrable
> archon.utils
> archon.version
```

## Test

```sh
yarn ganache
yarn test
```

## Build

```sh
yarn run build
```

## Update Docs

The documentation is based on Sphinx. Install Sphinx with your global python or in a virtualenv
```
pip install sphinx
```


1) Update `.rst` files in /docs


2) Run to generate new docs bundle
```
cd docs && make html
```

3) View changes
```
open ./docs/_build/html/index.html
```

4) Push changes
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@kleros/archon",
  "version": "2.0.2",
  "description": "A javascript library for Ethereum dispute resolution. Provides the ability to interface with Arbitrable and Arbitrator Ethereum smart contracts, as defined in ERC 792.",
  "license": "MIT",
  "keywords": [
    "Blockchain",
    "Ethereum",
    "Arbitration",
    "Arbitrable",
    "Arbitrator",
    "ERC 792",
    "Evidence",
    "MetaEvidence"
  ],
  "main": "dist/index.js",
  "files": [
    "dist",
    "src"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "build": "babel src -d dist",
    "docs": "esdoc",
    "ganache": "ganache-cli",
    "prepublishOnly": "run-s test build",
    "release": "standard-version",
    "test": "jest --config ./jest.config.js",
    "prepare": "husky install"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/runtime": "^7.15.4",
    "axios": "^0.21.0",
    "iframe": "^1.0.0",
    "js-sha3": "^0.8.0",
    "multihashes": "0.4.14",
    "v8-sandbox": "^2.2.2"
  },
  "peerDependencies": {
    "web3": "^1.3.6"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/cli": "^7.14.5",
    "@babel/core": "^7.12.3",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties": "^7.12.1",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "^7.12.1",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.12.1",
    "assert": "^2.0.0",
    "babel-eslint": "^10.1.0",
    "babel-jest": "^26.6.1",
    "electron": "^13.1.6",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^7.32.0",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "^8.3.0",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.22.1",
    "eslint-plugin-prettier": "^3.4.0",
    "ganache-cli": "^6.12.1",
    "ganache-core": "^2.13.2",
    "husky": ">=6",
    "jest": "^26.6.1",
    "jest-cli": "^26.6.1",
    "lint-staged": ">=10",
    "nock": "^13.0.4",
    "npm-run-all": "^4.1.5",
    "os-browserify": "^0.3.0",
    "prettier": "2.2.1",
    "prettier-config-standard": "^4.0.0",
    "solc": "0.4.25",
    "standard-version": "^9.0.0",
    "url": "^0.11.0",
    "util": "^0.12.3"
  },
  "volta": {
    "node": "14.17.3"
  },
  "lint-staged": {
    "*.js": "eslint --cache --fix"
  }
}
